snippet.title: 65 rescued from cable car line in Germany after midair collision
snippet.content:
Emergency services have rescued 65 people stranded in midair after a collision on a cable car line high above the Rhine river in Cologne, Germany. The line was immobilised for hours, and passengers were stuck in their cable cars.
Up Next
Massive fire causes festival evacuation
01:44
More World News Videos
Previous slide Next slide
Dramatic rescue from German cable cars
More than 100 cable car passengers were rescued after an accident left them stranded over the Rhine river in Cologne, Germany.
Twenty children were among those stranded. Rescue workers had to abseil passengers onto a fire department boat on the river.Photo: AP Other passengers clambered to safety on the shore or a major bridge from fire truck ladders. No injuries were reported.
The last person was rescued about five hours after the collision on the line.
You will now receive updates from

Emergency crews from surrounding towns were called in to help.Photo: AP More than 100 people were involved in the rescue effort. "Nothing like this has ever happened before," fire department spokesman Christian Heinisch said.Photo: AP Cologne authorities provided counselling for those people who had been stranded and were rescued. DPA
